Package org.lsmr.vending.hardware

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AbstractCoinAcceptor
    A simple interface to allow a device to communicate with another device that accepts coins.
    AbstractHardwareListener
    This class represents the abstract interface for all hardware listeners.
    AbstractPopCanAcceptor
    A simple interface to allow a device to communicate with another device that accepts pop cans.
    CoinRackListener
    Listens for events emanating from a coin rack.
    CoinReceptacleListener
    Listens for events emanating from a coin receptacle.
    CoinSlotListener
    Listens for events emanating from a coin slot.
    DeliveryChuteListener
    Listens for events emanating from a delivery chute.
    DisplayListener
    Listens for events emanating from a display device.
    IndicatorLightListener
    Listens for events emanating from an indicator light.
    LockListener
    Listens for events emanating from a lock.
    PopCanRackListener
    Listens for events emanating from a pop can rack.
    SelectionButtonListener
    Listens for events emanating from a selection button.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractHardware<T extends AbstractHardwareListener>
    The abstract base class for all hardware devices involved in the vending machine simulator.
    CoinChannel
    Represents a simple device (like, say, a tube) that allows coins to move between other devices.
    CoinRack
    Represents a device that stores coins of a particular denomination to dispense them as change.
    CoinReceptacle
    A temporary storage device for coins.
    CoinSlot
    Represents a simple coin slot device that has two output channels, one to a storage container and one to a coin return device.
    DeliveryChute
    Represents a simple delivery chute device.
    Display
    A simple device that displays a string.
    IndicatorLight
    A simple device that can be on or off as an indication to users.
    Lock
    A simple lock device to prevent or to permit the interior of the vending machine to be accessed.
    PopCanChannel
    Represents the hardware through which a pop can is carried from one device to another.
    PopCanRack
    Represents a storage rack for pop cans within the vending machine.
    SelectionButton
    Represents a simple push button on the vending machine.
    VendingMachine
    Represents a standard configuration of the vending machine hardware: one coin slot; one coin receptacle (called the coin receptacle) to temporarily store coins entered by the user; one coin receptacle (called the storage bin) to store coins that have been accepted as payment; a set of one or more coin racks (the number and the denomination of coins stored by each is specified in the constructor); one delivery chute used to deliver pop cans and to return coins; a set of one or more pop can racks (the number, cost, and pop name stored in each is specified in the constructor); one textual display; a set of one or more selection buttons (exactly one per pop can rack); and two indicator lights: one to indicate that exact change should be used by the user; the other to indicate that the machine is out of order.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    CapacityExceededException
    Indicates that the addition of an item has caused the device to overflow.
    DisabledException
    Issued when a device cannot perform its usual functions because it has been disabled.
    EmptyException
    Represents the situation when a device is emptied but an attempt is made to remove something from it.
    SimulationException
    An exception that can be raised when the behaviour within the simulator makes no sense, typically when it has not been configured correctly.
